chest pain; heart attack; headache; blood pressure was high; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 59-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on 28Mar2021 09:15 at single dose in left arm for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Irregular heart beat. The patient had no Allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included acetylsalicylic acid (BAYER ASPIRIN), and metoprolol. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 Prior to vaccination. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On Monday morning (29Mar2021 06:45), when the patient got out of bed she started having chest pain, took a shower and the pain got worse like she was having a heart attack, she was admitted to the hospital and treated for the pain and had EKG, stress test done, blood pressure was high, and she had a very bad headache; The events resulted Emergency room/department or urgent care. Tuesday morning (30Mar2021) the pain started to decreased and after another EKG and her blood pressure went down she was released and advised to follow up with her primary doctor as well as the cardiologist. Lab test included Nasal swab negative on 29Mar2021. Treatment was received for all events. The outcome of all events was resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

A 59-year-old female patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, lot number ER8727, expiration date: 31Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration in arm left on 07Apr2021 12:00 as single dose for Covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included allergy ( macro Danton, sulfa). Patient was not pregnant at time of vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient's concomitant medication included Nerontin. The patient reviously received flu vaccine and had normal things, previously received first dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: EN5318; Expiration Date: 31May2021) in arm left on 17Mar2021 16:00 and experienced acute lymphatic response, brain fog and arm started to hurt. The pateint was calling because her doctor, who she saw yesterday 14Apr2021, told her she should let Pfizer know what was going on. She had a reaction to the Pfizer Covid19 Vaccine. she was now having PVCs. The patient added that all of the events started with a fever, and throwing up. She had a fever and threw up for 36 hours. She had to contact her physician to get medication and to stop vomiting and the nausea and everything. During that time, she was sick. She was having intermittent breathing issues which she did not think she felt too much of until after the other sickness was over. She was weak, like people get after they are sick, and had bizarre shaking legs and arms which was strange. She added that she had breathing issues and difficulty breathing and hard to get a breath. That was what she was dealing with. Treatment: caller took Pedialyte and all the proper things to get back into better shape. The breathing issue still remained. The doctor called in a rescue inhaler. She kept going downhill so he called in a rescue inhaler. Large black bruise on left breast after second vaccine: Caller added that this one will not be believed but on Monday, she woke up and got dressed again and was just weak and had breathing issues but was just doing work on the laptop. She did not fall, she did not run into anything. In the evening, she went to take a bath and saw that when she took her clothes off there was a large black bruise on her left breast, it was probably 2 inches in diameter. It is very large, but does not hurt like a bruise. She checked the rest of her body for blood issues and only saw a couple normal looking bruises. She contacted her doctor, and they questioned her thoroughly on her bruising and activity. This was on Monday. Tuesday, she still felt the same headache, weak, and breathing issues. PVCs (Ventricular premature beat) after second vaccine: Yesterday, 14Apr2021, she started declining and the doctor wanted to see her. Caller stated the doctor heard PVCs in her heart. Caller asked clarification of PVC abbreviation and does not provide. She never had heart issues ever. The doctor did blood work and a chest x-ray, and saw the bruise and was worried about her blood. Caller added that even though these are not listed as side effects of the vaccine, she was worried. Her doctor sent her to a facility for chest x-rays to make sure there is no pulmonary embolism. Caller confirmed this was on 14Apr2021. She has not yet heard back. PVCs after second vaccine: Caller added the doctor said her lungs sounded good but wanted to see what was going on to see how her breathing was because there was difficulty. The doctor wanted to cover bases and check. Today, caller can tell her heart is still not in correct rhythm and that it is in continued PVCs. She still had the same breathing issues, limbs were weak, she was shaky, and she is lightheaded. She was hoping to wake up today and feel better. Fever after second vaccine: started 3am 08Apr2021. She had a fever and was throwing up at this time. Throwing up and nausea after second vaccine: caller add that throwing up and vomiting with nausea occurred at 3 am, all of this occurred 08APR2021. The vomiting lasted 36 hours, and it ended when she took medication. The fever lasted 40 hours. Even after the medication worked for her fever, she had nausea. Around Friday was when it went away. Intermittent breathing issues after second vaccine: caller adds it started with throwing up and fever, but she did not think a lot about this or know when it started because she was dealing with the fever and vomiting. It continued, and it has not subsided or ended. As a matter of fact, there are 2 or 3 times it has gotten bad which is why she was given an inhaler. Treatments: caller took a Phenergan suppository, which she adds is the best medicine in the World for nausea and beats Zofran. She had used two or three doses and it did work. She used a rescue inhaler, Albuterol Sulfate HFA. She took Tylenol for fever. She is also now taking an aspirin daily because of the blood issues. No additional information regarding the products. Weak after second vaccine: caller adds that this started at the same time, she was over the nausea and noticed this. It felt different than what it feels like with the flu. This is still going on, she did not think too much about it but it has persisted. Sometimes there is a little bit of shaking but that is intermittent. Caller states she can not put it into words. Bizarre shaking legs and arms after second vaccine: this goes with the weakness, she is continually weak but she has a shaky feeling that will come every now and then and is random. Large black bruise on left breast after second vaccine: Monday this started, 12APR2021 and it is still there but it is the same. It has not been sore like a bruise but it is black and large. The physician has seen it now and it is bizarre and scary. It is the left breast on the outside. Headache after second vaccine: started probably an hour after the vaccine, pretty quick. There were degrees to this headache because it was an actual migraine for a good 48 hours and even after the fever was gone it was terrible. It started out just a mild headache and then was very severe for a couple of days. Then, after that it was just there but not as severe. PVCs after second vaccine: caller adds that she went to the doctor yesterday 14APR2021 and she can tell every now and again that she is having these but there is nothing she can do about it. Caller adds this is everything new she can think of, but some of it is foggy, she thinks this is the main information. Brain fog after first and second vaccine: Caller then states, by the way, after both vaccines within 2 or 3 minutes of having them her head started feeling foggy and weird. Investigations: caller has not received any results yet. She did get an EKG, Chest XRAY, blood work, and the doctor also rattled off a bunch of things the doctor was going to check. These all were on 14Apr2021 and she is waiting on results. Caller confirms the physician told her she had PVCs while listening to caller's heart. Did any AE require a visit to: Physician office? 15Apr2021 she was in contact with her physician, and the whole week they were on the phone. Yesterday 14Apr2021 the physician wanted to see her. The doctor figured out something was going on with her heart so thankfully the doctor wanted to see her. It was discussed if caller should go to the ER but caller did everything she could not to go because that is the last place she wants to go. Emergency Room: no. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of fever, vomiting, nausea was recovered, intermittent breathing issues, shaking legs and arms, weak, severe migraine, headache was not recovered, for other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Her foot had been injured from being twisted too many times. It was an old injury. Concomitant medications included atenolol; omeprazole; venlafaxine; and hydrochlorothiazide, valsartan (VALSARTAN/HCTZ TEVA); all ongoing. Probably about 15 years ago, she received a flu vaccine where her husband worked. His place of employment offered flu vaccines to employees and their families every year. She went to get the flu vaccine and that was probably around 9:00AM and by the time she got off work that day she was so sick with the chills that she crawled into bed. It felt like she had the flu. The next day she felt better just worn out. She hasn't had a flu vaccine since then. She received her first Covid 19 vaccine on 05Feb2021 and about 20 minutes after (05Feb2021 13:50), she received the vaccine her hands started itching and she didn't think a lot about it. As time wore on, the itching moved up her arms and down her legs and then her whole body was itching. By Sunday, 07Feb2021 she had a rash and welts and the rash was moving up in her face. She went to the emergency room on Sunday, 07Feb2021 because the rash was on her face. She was getting scared. She was miserable. She was taking Benadryl and it wasn't doing anything for her. The emergency room gave her a Benadryl injection and liquid steroids and prescribed 2 epinephrine pens (Epi-pens) in case she started to have problems breathing. She did not have trouble breathing. She also received pills to help with her itching. She was still taking those pills because she was still itching. As of 23Apr2021, it was still persisting nothing has improved slightly. It keeps her up at night, making her miserable, and described it as severe. She had spots where she bleeds from scratching. She was up all night two days ago because the itching was so bad. The pills do help but she has to work so she can not take too many or she will be asleep at her desk. Patient hoped that Pfizer would have something to tell her healthcare provider about what to do for her. She was advised by her doctor to not get the second Covid 19 vaccine. She went to her family doctor about a week later and explained what had happened with the Covid 19 vaccine and her doctor was able to review her emergency room visit paperwork. Her primary care doctor prescribed more of the pills for itching because she had gone through the pills that the emergency department prescribed. She reported that the rash has improved but at times, all of a sudden, she'll start itching and it's the type of itching that she can't stop scratching. With scratching it will grow into welts and a rash and then it goes away. She doesn't like to take the pills prescribed for itching because she doesn't like to take medicine. The itching kept her up all night in different parts of her body. The itching will ease down and then the itching will stop and then probably a good hour will pass and the rash will go away. The only thing that was left to see was where she scratched on her body. She still has red spots on her arms that weren't there before. She wouldn't call those spots a rash. The pill she was prescribed for itching is Hydroxyzine 25mg take one by mouth every 6 hours as needed for itching. This one helps but she doesn't want to take it because it can make her tired and she has to work. Outcome of the event "hands started itching/itching moved up her arms and down her legs and then her whole body was itching" was not recovered while unknown for other events.

The patient received her second Covid 19 vaccination on March 11 but was experiencing some myalgias. She had multiple sick contacts at home with COVID-19 infection. Unfortunately she had diarrhea and poor p.o. intake and developed dehydration. She came to the emergency department for further evaluation after she had her vital signs at home and saw her heart rate was elevated and her blood pressure was low. She was found to have a sinus tachycardia with hypotension upon arrival despite the fact that she has been holding her blood pressure medications for several days. She was hypokalemic. Covid swab came back positive. She was given IV fluids and potassium was replaced her blood pressure remained on the lower side. She was admitted to the hospital and started on steroids. She met criteria for remdesivir and convalescent plasma with saturation at 90% on room air on the second day of her admission. She completed a 5-day course of remdesivir. She was given a unit of convalescent plasma. Her potassium normalized. Her heart rate normalized. She had a better oral intake. Metoprolol tartrate was started on a lower dose for blood pressure and heart rate control. Her blood pressure remained in the normal range off her lisinopril and Norvasc. She does have history of Leiden 5 and with a history of DVT and takes Xarelto. She had a D-dimer which was checked which was normal. She continued on her Xarelto as an inpatient. She has clinically improved and is now ready for discharge. She is agreeable to remote patient monitoring and that has been arranged. She should follow-up with her family doctor in 1 week. Her lisinopril and Norvasc were discontinued at discharge. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of deep vein thrombosis which included Prescribed Xarelto. The adverse event result in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The outcome of event was not recovered. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19.
59 2021-05-16 vaginal haemorrhage Patient is menopausal and experienced vaginal bleeding lasting about 2 days. Heavy enough bleeding ... Read more
Close
Patient is menopausal and experienced vaginal bleeding lasting about 2 days. Heavy enough bleeding that required a pad, but it did not saturate the pad.
59 2021-05-19 cerebrovascular accident stroke like symptoms; similar to migraines; mini-strokes; Passing Out; Blind spots in her vision; Na... Read more
Close
stroke like symptoms; similar to migraines; mini-strokes; Passing Out; Blind spots in her vision; Nausea; Believes it effected her memory; stroke like symptoms; similar to migraines; mini-strokes; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer. A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on 16Apr2021 (Lot Number: EW0153; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021) as 1ST DOSE, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation (Age at vaccination: 59 years). Medical history included ongoing strokes, ongoing third and fourth Nerve Palsy. Concomitant medications included dabigatran etexilate mesilate (PRADAXA) taken for blood thinner; metoprolol for Stroke, Heart regulation; lovastatin taken for Stroke, Heart regulation. The patient states that she went to the Emergency Room on 17Apr2021 and then went again on either 18Apr2021 or 19Apr2021. The patient states she does not know if she was admitted or not. States that she thinks she just was in the emergency room the time that she was there. Says that after the Covid Vaccine she was having stroke like symptoms; similar to migraines; mini-strokes. She was passing out, had nausea, blind spots in her vision, and she believes it effected her memory. The events occurred on 17Apr2021. Also, she said on her first emergency room visit they did a CT Scan and on her second emergency room visit they did a MRI and both was not reported. States they told her there was no issues. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included CT Scan: and MRI: not reported on Apr2021. Outcome of the event vision impairment was not recovered while outcome of the event nausea was recovered on Apr2021. Outcome of the event memory impairment was recovering while outcome of the remaining events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
The patient called us and said she received her COVID vaccine of Pfizer on 5-21-21. She said when she received her vaccine she bleed and the person administering the vaccine wiped up the blood twice after administering the vaccine. She said he has a bruise from the shot.
59 2021-05-25 transient ischaemic attack 1. 3/21 leading up to 3/31 I had a low grade fever that would not go away. 2. 3/31 at 2am, hit wi... Read more
Close
1. 3/21 leading up to 3/31 I had a low grade fever that would not go away. 2. 3/31 at 2am, hit with bout of intense nausea which continued through 4/-3. The most intense was 3/31-4/1. 3. 4/3-4/4 my right side under rib cage was screaming in pain Treatment -- went to doctor's office on 4/2 to make sure not covid (tested negative), given a perscription for nausea. Called Dr.'s office and advised to go to Primary Care Physician. Also, advised hot water bottle on organs that hurt. The hot water bottle soothed the intense pain. Had soup when could tolerate it. 4. Went to doctor's office on 4/5 regarding the intense pain on right side. An abdominal Ultrasound was ordered. April 25, 4am, my eye sight went to seeing 1/2 of objects and words, then went to tunnel vision. 1. I saw Primary Physician who referred me to an opthamalogist. 2. Opthamalogist saw nothing wrong with eye -- suggested taking baby asprin and that there had been a TIA, referred me back to Primary Physician for a referral to Cardiologist / Vascular physician
59 2021-05-27 cerebrovascular accident May 5, 2021- was admitted to hospital with an ATI stroke!
59 2021-06-01 pneumonia, acute respiratory failure 5/16/21 Pt presented to a free standing ED with complaints of cough, body aches, nasal congestion an... Read more
Close
5/16/21 Pt presented to a free standing ED with complaints of cough, body aches, nasal congestion and otalgia that started around 5/11/21. In the ED she had audible wheezing, mild tachypnea (RR19) and her RA pulse ox was 88-943%. She was placed on oxygen and found to be positive for SARS-CoV-2. CXR showed possible pneumonia and she was transferred to a tertiary care facility for admission. She was discharged on 5/21/21 Acute hypoxic respiratory failure, resolved Covid-19 Virus Infection Date of onset of symptoms: Approximately 7 days prior (5/15/2021) Symptoms present on admission: Nasal congestion, myalgias, productive cough of yellow-green sputum, diarrhea Date of covid positive test: 5/16 Vaccination status: vaccinated, received only first dose Imaging: CXR with lobar pneumonia Oxygen requirements on admission: 2 L Current oxygen requirements: None Medical therapy: Oral prednisone, not a candidate for remdesivir Inflammatory markers: CRP 18.1, ferritin 111, D-dimer 0.62, LDH 174 Community-acquired pneumonia Given lobar appearance on CXR and productive cough of green/yellow sputum I do feel it prudent to cover the patient for community-acquired pneumonia Treated with Azithromycin, Augmentin Acute on chronic kidney disease Baseline serum creatinine approximately 1.1-1.2, presenting serum creatinine 1.94 Prerenal versus intrinsic renal 2/2 infection Creatinine trending down to 1.24 at time of discharge COPD with acute exacerbation IV Solu-Medrol initially, transition to oral prednisone Schedule bronchodilators Started Symbicort per hospital formulary, and held home Flovent while hospitalized Antibiotic coverage as above
59 2021-06-03 pulmonary embolism Pulmonary emboli

59 2021-06-10 pneumonia J18.9 - Pneumonia, unspecified organism
59 2021-06-10 blood clot Incarcerated and ischemic bowel due to massive thrombosis of portal vein and SMV; Incarcerated and i... Read more
Close
Incarcerated and ischemic bowel due to massive thrombosis of portal vein and SMV; Incarcerated and ischemic bowel due to massive thrombosis of portal vein and SMV; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 59-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration on 23Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8736) as single dose at the age of 59-year-old for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included pre-myelofibrosis aspirin on daily baby. No known allergies. Concomitant medication(s) included acetylsalicylic acid (BABY ASPIRIN) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 on 02Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: ER2613) as single dose at the age of 59-year-old for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient experienced incarcerated and ischemic bowel due to massive thrombosis of portal vein and SMV (hospitalization, disability, life threatening) on 09May2021 with outcome of recovering. The adverse events resulted in any Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient was hospitalized for the events for 26 days. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Sars-cov-2 test: negative on 24May2021 Nasal Swab. The treatment received for the adverse event was emergency bowel resection. Since the vaccination, has the patient been tested for COVID-19. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
59 2021-06-17 atrial fibrillation At 11pm I was awakened due to my rapid heart rate. I began to feel nauseous, had jaw pain and pain ... Read more
Close
At 11pm I was awakened due to my rapid heart rate. I began to feel nauseous, had jaw pain and pain in my left shoulder. I went to the hospital where I was diagnosed with A-Fib. I was admitted overnight and discharged the next day.
59 2021-06-18 pulmonary embolism Chest pain started 6 days after Pfizer shot. I was admitted to hospital on June 1 2021 with a pulmon... Read more
Close
Chest pain started 6 days after Pfizer shot. I was admitted to hospital on June 1 2021 with a pulmonary embolism. I was put on heparin drip and discharged on June 4. And was placed on Eliquis for approximately a year.

59 2021-06-20 death The patient was vaccinated on 5/26/21 for dose one and 6/16/21 for dose two with Pfizer COVID-19 vac... Read more
Close
The patient was vaccinated on 5/26/21 for dose one and 6/16/21 for dose two with Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Patient passed away the day following her second dose on 6/17/21.
